III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• In the area of initial documentation there is good narrative located within youth
files, but the facility is advised to make clear the description by staff of a youth's
preparation for placement.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The facility utilizes an adequate computer system for record keeping of youth files
and can put effort in to how to best display which staff and supervisors approve
service plans.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
2

Maltreatment in Care
One investigation produced a result of maltreatment during this report period. The
staff member involved in this incident had their employment terminated and the
coinciding licensing investigation produced a rule violation and Corrective Action
Plan.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
There were two approved CAPs during this report period. The previous years'
renewal inspection produced rule violations for dental exams for youth, assessing
criminal history of prospective employees and timeliness of performance
evaluations. The action steps in this CAP were successful in that there were no
repeat rule violations in this inspection. The other CAP during this report period
resulted from a special investigation, SIR #2024C0000985SI. The rule violation
was for CCI Rule 400.4158 (1) (a) (ii). Action steps included the termination of
employment for the employee involved and re-training staff on prohibited acts
towards youth and crisis intervention. This CAP was successful. Interviews with
staff regarding that specific incident and debriefing and training that occurred
afterwards produced positive results.
Financial Overview
Yearly budgeting for the program was provided and reviewed and no concerns
were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator provided an assessment dated 03/25/2025. This covered
the facility's efforts to keep restraints and seclusions at a minimum through
strategies with youth and procedures for day-to-day activities. Previous non-
compliances were reviewed, and the efforts made through the CAP from the 2024
renewal were successful. There had been no unplanned discharges during this
reporting period.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility on
03/25/2025. Consistent positive experiences working at the facility were noted.
Staff felt well trained and supported in their work with the youth. Staff reported
some struggles presented by the recent lower census of youth (i.e. less activity
over the course of the day, youth having more time to focus on their own stressors)
3

but they reported having the ability to build rapport and work with the youth to help
them as best they can.
Youth were interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility on
03/25/2025. Youth reported feeling safe and well cared for at the facility. They
were able to have adequate communication with their families and caseworkers.
They reported good experiences with staff and felt properly cared for.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility was toured during an unannounced, face-to-face visit on 03/25/2025.
The building was in clean and organized condition and no concerns were noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
